org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.mail
Class MailConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.mail.MailConnection
public class MailConnection
extends java.lang.Object

Simple helper class to read in the properties specific to creating a connection to a remote mail server (either via POP3 or IMAP protocols) and provides some utilities to manipulate folders and mail messages.

Note: The POP3 specification does not support multiple folders so if you use the MoveToFolder property you will get an error and the adaptor will exit. The move function only works with IMAP servers.

Author:
Russ Fennell

closeFolder

public void closeFolder(javax.mail.Folder fldr,
                        boolean expunge)
                 throws javax.mail.MessagingException

deleteMsg

public void deleteMsg(javax.mail.Message msg)
               throws javax.mail.MessagingException

getBody

public java.lang.Object getBody(javax.mail.Message msg)
                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                java.io.IOException
Returns:
the body from the supplied message or null if there was a problem
Throws:
javax.mail.MessagingException - if there was a problem reading the message status
java.io.IOException - if the body content could not be retrieved
